ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Course is designed so that the topics build on each other. By end of course really feel like you have a sense of the main issues entailed in urban sociology. Would definitely recommend this course to those who are interested in the topic.

The course gives a great introduction to the multidisciplinary approaches urbanism from the sociological lens. It introduces many of the leading authors and scholars and their arguments. I would highly recommend the course.
I would definitely recommend this class to other graduate students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: A case I hope to work with for my dissertation is in Manhattan. Taking this course gave me the tools to properly situate and contextualize my case and made me aware of a number of issues that I would not have considered had I not taken this class.
As a student in the School of Architecture, this course was not part of any dissertation or particular research. It was effective for obtaining knowledge in an unfamiliar, yet appropriate field.
